result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa J. Butcher

defendant.name: Butcher, Lisa J.

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Lisa J. Butcher in court.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Lisa J. Butcher.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense speaks to the assessment.  Follow through has been completed. State/Defense speak to continue to move cases along. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No contact with Heather Grande or Travis Young, Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with assessment appointment scheduled for 8/11/22.

3:33 PM Defendant Lisa J. Butcher in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Lisa J. Butcher.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Defense to speak on a bond modification. State speaks to the request from defense.  Court modifies bond to $500.00 CASH - No contact with Heather Grande or Travis Young, Maintain absolute sobriety. Amended bond form.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of motion, motion to modify bond

11:14 AM Defendant Lisa J. Butcher in court, in custody. Attorney Jolin appears by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint received by defense, waive reading.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: No contact with Heather Grande or Travis Young, Maintain absolute sobriety.

11:44 AM Defendant Lisa J. Butcher appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of complaint.  Court reads charges.  Attorney rights given.  Court has conflict and case will be reassigned.  Clerk to complete reassignment application. State speaks to the incident that lead to defendant's arrest.  Bond set at $4,500 CASH with conditions: No contact with Heather Grande or Travis Young, Maintain absolute sobriety.  Bond form.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
